title: Tory by-election candidate says he will only do the job for a year
description: Sam Bromiley is running to replace Tory MP Chris Skidmore, who quit over a bill to guarantee annual oil and gas licensing rounds

title: CITY WHISPERS: Jacob Rees-Mogg hits out at Davos man... including his pal Lord Dominic Johnson
description: Among the attendees was Somerset MP and ex-Brexit Opportunities Minister Jacob Rees-Mogg, who proudly proclaimed in a speech that 'the age of Davos man is over'. He was referring to the gathering of the financial and political elite at the World Economic Forum, held in the Swiss ski destination last month.

title: Sadiq Khan saving up for huge ‘pre-election spending spree’, say Tories
description: Sadiq Khan’s Conservative opponent Susan Hall has accused the London Mayor of “squirrelling away” vast sums to spend on the police and other services in a “pre-election spending spree”. Mr Khan is thought to be preparing to announce a funding boost for the Metropolitan Police as part of a new budget this week.

title: Gove: Young people shut out of housing market could turn to authoritarianism
description: Michael Gove has warned that young people shut out of the UK’s housing market could turn to authoritarianism. The Housing Secretary said a failure by the Government to tackle the housing crisis could endanger democracy, as well as the Conservatives’ chances at the general election.

title: Gove: Young people shut out of housing market could turn to authoritarianism
description: Michael Gove has warned that young people shut out of the UK’s housing market could turn to authoritarianism. The Housing Secretary said a failure by the Government to tackle the housing crisis could endanger democracy, as well as the Conservatives’ chances at the general election.

title: ‘He’s toast!’ Reform taunts Rishi Sunak as PM fights for Brexiteer vote in by-elections
description: Reform UK candidate Ben Habib believes Rishi Sunak cannot fight back as Conservatives try to hold on to Wellingborough and Kingswood seats in by-elections.

title: Army in crisis as troop numbers slump despite £40m spent on recruitment
description: Fears Britain will not be able to counter international threats as Army falls short of target on soldiers despite Ministry of Defence investment.

title: Rod Stewart calls for Tories to ‘step down’ and give Labour ‘a go’ in resurfaced clip
description: The singer recently hit out at the Conservatives. In an interview with The Times on Friday (9 February), he called Boris Johnson a “lying f***ing public schoolboy” and called for the Tories to be booted out of No10. In a resurfaced clip from an ...
